subject: Politics
title: Freedom of Speech Limits
description: A quick win: understand Freedom of Speech Limits.

hook.text: Should Nazis be allowed to march through a Jewish neighborhood? Free speech has limits. The question is where.

buildup.text: Most democracies protect free speech but draw lines at incitement, defamation, and threats of violence.

discovery.text: The US protects almost all speech. Germany bans Nazi symbols. Each democracy draws the line differently.

twist.text: Social media complicates everything. Private platforms can censor freely, and hate speech spreads at scale.

climax.text: Too much restriction kills dissent. Too little enables harm. Every democracy struggles to find balance.

punchline.text: Free speech is never absolute. The debate is where to draw the line.

quiz.question: How do the US and Germany differ on free speech?
options: The US protects nearly all speech while Germany bans Nazi symbols
Both countries have identical free speech protections
Germany protects more speech than the United States
